page.title: 17PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: There are six public houses in our survey area: The Plough & Harrow, New Leathern Bottle and Three Legged Cross in Warfield, and The Jack O'Newbury, Stag & Hounds and Victoria Arms in Binfield. The population of Warfield and Binfield is just 4,700 and, as there are other pubs in the area, those listed rely on lunch time trade from Bracknell and local custom These country pubs offer between them everything from modern entertainment to a traditional 'old world' atmosphere e.g. The Stag & Hounds became a public house in 1727 and is mentioned in William Cobbett's "Rural Rides". The revenue from the sale of food has become an important source of income for publicans and between them the pubs offer everything from bar snacks to full meals.
